results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.

results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.
results.description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. results.title: Pig too far gone
results.brief_description: Chief Kosher is having a hard time busting open a crime ring and nabbing the King Pin, when the cops he sends undercover find it impossible to go unnoticed. His only option is to send in loose-cannon McBurger, which could be his best or worst decision to date.
results.description: Chief Kosher is having a hard time busting open a crime ring and nabbing the King Pin, when the cops he sends undercover find it impossible to go unnoticed. His only option is to send in loose-cannon McBurger, which could be his best or worst decision to date.

results.title: Paper War
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Guan Wei
results.brief_description: This simple tracking shot along Guan Wei’s exquisitely drawn battle scenes, silhouetted against a traditional landscape scroll, suggests the right-to-left movement of Chinese reading.

results.title: Blurring the boundaries
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Craig Walsh
results.brief_description: Repurposing documentation of his wild installation, where unexpected images are projected onto a shop window in Vietnam, Craig Walsh captures the interaction between art and its audience.

results.title: OverDrawn
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Martin Walch
results.brief_description: Martin Walch mixes the toxic beauty of his own photographs with industrial and geographic documentation in this animated pan across an area of the Mt Lyell mine, Tasmania.

results.title: Short band video
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Daniel von Sturmer
results.brief_description: Continuing from his ‘Truth Effect’ series, and the tradition of George Méliès, Daniel von Sturmer creates a miniature environment in which an everyday object behaves in unexpected ways.

results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
